trans-unit.source: Connecting to databases outside the system directory

seg-source.mrk: Connecting to databases outside the system directory

target.mrk: Connecting to databases outside the system directory

trans-unit.source: You can also connect to databases in other directories (including subdirectories of the system directory) by specifying a relative or absolute path name to identify the database. The way you specify an absolute path is defined by the host operating system.

seg-source.mrk: You can also connect to databases in other directories (including subdirectories of the system directory) by specifying a relative or absolute path name to identify the database.
The way you specify an absolute path is defined by the host operating system.

target.mrk: You can also connect to databases in other directories (including subdirectories of the system directory) by specifying a relative or absolute path name to identify the database.
The way you specify an absolute path is defined by the host operating system.

trans-unit.source: Using the connection URL as described here, you can connect to databases in more than one directory at a time.

seg-source.mrk: Using the connection URL as described here, you can connect to databases in more than one directory at a time.

target.mrk: Using the connection URL as described here, you can connect to databases in more than one directory at a time.

trans-unit.source: Once connected, such a database becomes a part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system, even though it is not in the system directory. This means that it takes on the system-wide properties of the system and no other instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> should access that database. It is recommended that you connect to databases only in the system directory.

seg-source.mrk: Once connected, such a database becomes a part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system, even though it is not in the system directory.
This means that it takes on the system-wide properties of the system and no other instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> should access that database.
It is recommended that you connect to databases only in the system directory.

target.mrk: Once connected, such a database becomes a part of the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> system, even though it is not in the system directory.
This means that it takes on the system-wide properties of the system and no other instance of <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> should access that database.
It is recommended that you connect to databases only in the system directory.
